inn1.comm: back of a length around off stump, blocked on the crease
a little fuller, played in the same defensive manner around off stump, it come off high on Cook's bat towards cover, well short of the fielder but a little leading edge
full, down the leg side and the innings is underway
back of a length, Cook pulls and finds long leg on a couple of bounces
nicely bowled, back of a length and it nips away from Bell a little who was beaten outside off just feeling for it a little on the back foot
a little wide of off stump, Bell tries to cut and gets it off the toe, it bounces towards second slip and Cook dashes through for a quick single
full and down leg side and Cook tickles it for four
full on leg stump, chipped over midwicket, not really timed and they just get a couple, no run from this outfield
Bell steps to leg and forces away through extra cover, nicely timed that, very well timed in fact because it runs to the longest boundary even with this sluggish outfield
wander towards the bowler a little and ends up defending a length ball back to the bowler

gives himself a little room again and off drives in the air, doesn't get it, back goes Franklin and he shells the chance he made the ground comfortably, tried to take it with two hands but spilled it over his right shoulder
length ball just outside off, flicked through square leg
full of length just outside off, Cook drives and finds short extra cover, good save

length ball on off stump, Bell steps away and slaps hard to short extra cover who holds on to a blinding catch with two hands at his right shoulder, a very sharp take, that was hammered by Bell off the meat of the bat but he got it straight at Brendon McCullum who's clung on very well indeed there
drives the first ball in front of point on the front foot, it's well timed but half-saved, they get two
back of a length just outside off stump, blocked on the crease, it runs in to the off side but they refuse a quick single that might have been available
goes to flick from off stump through square leg, gets hit on the thigh pad and it runs to point
full just outside off stump, Trott forward and driving really nicely, that is very well timed and gets four to the right of mid-off, classic stroke
length ball just outside off stump, waited for and late cuts past slip, it's fine of third man and Trott runs very hard and gets back for the second
short enough to chop away from just outside off stump, third man comes around and is able to save the second, I thought they should have got two there

full on the stumps, clipped straight to short midwicket and this time it's Nathan McCullum that's held the chance, this one far simpler than his sibling, taken with two hands around stomach height. It was in the slot for Trott to clip away thorough the on-side but he got across his stumps a little too much and couldn't keep the stroke down
stays back and plays from just outside off stump towards point
back on his stumps and gets a genuine nick from just outside off stump, it flies short and wide of Ross Taylor at slip and such are the short straight boundaries here that that's four
back on the off stump again, this time pushes in to the gully
cut but off the toe of the bat and Williamson fields at cover point
a little floater outside off and Cook drives through the covers, Guptill's relay to McNath isn't great and they get back for three
full on the stumps, dug out back to the bowler
full outside off, Root drives but only finds point, rather missed out, he timed it okay
drives again and pushes this wide of mid-off for an easy single
back foot push to extra cover from a foot outside
length outside off, Cook goes to cut and it bounces a little and beats him, carries to Ronchi just over shoulder height
full on off stump, it swings a little as Root tries to play through the on side, he gets a big outside edge and it flies past gully to third man, very lucky
back of a length on leg stump, clipped down to long leg
flicked at off the back foot outside off stump, played and missed, a hint of movement again away from the bat
driven at on the front foot a good few feet outside off, doesn't get it at all and it runs to cover
flashing driven outside off, gets it through the ring this time and just a single as the deep cover point comes in to field
full delivery, blocked up the wicket, the bowler tumbles to his right but can't save and they take a quick run to the left of mid-on
back of a length just outside off, cut hard out to the sweeper
slider it looked like, Root tried to slap it through the off side and chinese cut it past the leg stump
step away for a bit of room and hard backward of point, the sweeper can come around and save the second though
back on his stumps and pushed down the ground to long off
fuller on the stumps, clipped through square leg, might get too but no, they don't take on deep backward square leg
Root gets lucky again trying to play off the back foot through the leg side, gets a bottom edge past off stump but wide of short third man for a single
back of a length pulled from outside off and dropped at midwicket by McNath, it was straight to him but struck very firmly, probably went underhand and should have gone overhanded Aussie style
comes back into Root and cramps him trying to cut, comes off high on the bat to the keeper's right for a single
full and swings away and beats Cook wild cover drive
tries to play  a full ball to the on side and gets a leading edge through gully to third man, didn't know much about that
steps back and heaves over midwicket, doesn't get it at all really and it's chipped over the infielder but in front of the sweeper
forward, driven at on middle and leg, an outside edge runs down to third man
a shimmy down the wicket and driven hard back to the bowler
another shimmy down, opens the face from a very full length and steers it past extra cover
back and a goes to pull, comes off the thigh pad to short long leg, they hurry through for a run
Cook down the wicket and swings a stroke down the ground, gets an inside edge past leg stump, rather fortunate, the 45 goes back towards fine leg
swept hard from off stump to deep square leg
back on his stumps, a quicker ball at 57mph, gets something on it to the 45 and they take a quick single
tries to sweep a ball outside leg stump and gets hit on the chest, missed completely
outside off, cut from low on the bat and they get a run to the cover sweeper
off stump and swept hard out to deep square leg
down the wicket but just pushed to short extra cover

slightly back in length, Root goes right back in his crease and lifts it into the stands over midwicket, fine strike and the first six for England that wasn't from the bat of Ravi Bopara this tournament
forward and pushed down to long off
goes to force outside off, it skids through under the stroke outside off stump
shimmy down and meets it on the full, well struck but a superb diving save in front of the pavilion saves four, fine work from Taylor
down the wicket and helped up and over wide long on for a once-bounce four, bit of a heave but does the job
runs this to mid-on on the edge of the circle, easy single
back and hit on the pad trying to play to leg, pitched well outside leg stump
full ball, slog swept out to the deep midwicket

swept from the stumps, swung to leg misses and is given out lbw after some delibration. It looked good for me, but there's an inside edge onto the pad and Root survives, he didn't review it straight away so didn't know he hit it but will get a reprieve
driven from just outside off stump past extra cover, deep cover comes to his right and they get a couple
forward and pressed back to the bowler
down the wicket and played in the air through cover to the sweeper
swept from middle and off to the deep backward square leg
length ball just outside off stump, cut hard to extra cover
full ball just outside off and hammered over the bowler's head, he gave himself a little room to swing the arms and cleared the straight fence, good club
stays in the crease and pushes out through point
back of a length at the body, swiveled down to long leg
back of a length, goes to pull but it's not there for the stroke and it's a bit of a toe into the on side, midwicket fields
down on one knee just outside off stump and paddled fine for four, lovely stroke, a nice touch, long leg came up in the circle and he scooped it through 45 very nicely
chipped from the stumps to midwicket and McNath shells another this jumping high, he parries it to start with, then grabbed it but spilt it hitting the ground
swept off middle and leg behind square on the leg side, nicely played
waits for it and pushed off the stumps backward of point
down the wicket, goes to drive over the top and gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
sweeps hard to the deep square leg
length ball just outside off, played off the back foot through cover point
full ball just outside off stump, played to mid-on, on the edge of the circle
bit of bounce just outside off stump, Cook goes to cut and gets it low on the bat towards point to bring the 100 up

step to leg, goes to swing over the leg side, he's late on the stroke and pulls straight up in the air and Ronchi takes an easy catch running out a little way towards square leg, Root got into an awkward position trying to pull a ball that was onto him a little quicker than he might have thought, may have bounced a little more too and put it straight up
full ball, pushed back towards the bowler who saves with a left boot
short outside off, cut hard off a bit of a top edge, runs quickly to third man who does well to save four and they run very well and get back for the second
slower ball, full, driven out to the cover rope
short and well wide of off stump
another bumper, better line but now too high says the square leg umpire
full on middle stump, forward and pushed slightly in the air but well short of mid-on and they get a quick single
goes back and forces just behind point for a quick single
down the wicket and slapped to point, a dolly to McNath who has put down a sitter oh dear straight to him and it's bounced off his chest, whoops
back to cut and missed outside off, it lifted a little
forward and pressed into the covers for a quick single
back and cut, it's wide of the sweeper and they take two as the sweeper runs to his right
back and late cuts from just outside off to short third man, Morgan is through in a flash for the single
down the wicket and slugged down the ground, fifty for Cook, just a single to long on off a thick inside edge really
steps back and cuts past extra cover, two wide of the sweeper, big areas square here
reverse sweep, it was held back by McNath and it was tickled to short third man
Cook shimmies down and drives to short extra cover
full and Cook yorks himself, digs it out to short extra but just wide of him for a single
started to come down, it was fired in to leg stump, Morgan adjusts and pushes through midwicket
gave himself room for the slog sweep, didn't time it, gets it out to deep midwicket
down the wicket and hit over long off, the first time Cook has hit two sixes in an ODI innings, another good strike, gave himself a little room and struck it well
flat delivery, ran out from the stumps to deep cover
down the wicket, gets in a tangle trying to play to leg, comes off the body into the covers
down again and goes wide of long off this time, enough on it to get it tricking into the rope
leg stump and clips through midwicket to the deep fielder
down the track, meets this on the full and plays out to deep cover
fetched from outside off and that's into the river, huge strike, nailed it way over long on, that was six anywhere, quite a flat delivery and hammered
fetched again from outside off but slaps it to deep midwicket, not timed that at all

down the wicket, Cook slaps it back to the bowler and this time McNath holds on, waits for the chance to give himself a wicket and finally, at the fourth time of asking, holds the catch at waist height, Cook didn't get to the pitch of the ball and slapped it back in the air and McCullum finally held a chance, top knock from Cook
off stump delivery, waited for and pushed down to long off
off stump, stays in the crease and carves to point
down the track and drives in-to-out down to long off
reverse sweep, struck in line but too high
down the track, slapped hard from the stumps to mid off

swept hard and misses, this time it's fuller and given out lbw that looked pretty adjacent and the finger went up pretty quickly. Quicker ball from Vettori and Morgan missed it, not in the best of form this season is Morgan, struggled to time much today and perishes swinging and missing
forward on the stumps, ran into the leg side, the keeper pops up from behind the stumps to field
quicker ball skids on and Bopara blocks in the crease
full ball just outside off, powered away past extra-cover, really nicely struck
back of a length, cramps Buttler and it comes off the chest guard towards point for a leg bye
back of a length just outside off, blocked in front of point for a quick single
stays in the crease and guides down to third man, 150 up
gives himself room just outside off but drives off an inside edge into the body that runs away towards cover point
back of a length again, dabbed down to third man from just outside off
poor ball, 66mph, leg stump, pulled past square leg, put away nicely, good start for England
slower ball, yorker length, dug out through the covers, oh dear, overstepped
full outside off, swung to deep cover, catch taken but of course that doesn't count and they get a single

length ball, slower, 69mph, slapped to long off, McNath again! And he holds on just inside the boundary, Buttler got it low on the bat and it was so badly mistimed, presented a simple chance for the fielder, tried to clear the front leg but just didn't get it at all right
full ball on the stumps, blocked forward back to the bowler
shot, gives himself room and carves a length ball through cover, lovely timing
slower ball again, 71mph, just outside off stump, cut at and gets it low on the bat towards point for a single
steps to leg and aims over cover, gets it to extra cover on the edge of the circle, the bowler follow him as he stepped away
driven at outside off, squirt off a thick outside edge and nearly evades short third man, Mills does well

clears the front leg and swings over the leg side, Bopara missed but there's an appeal for caught behind, not out given, but they try the review they have left. Any touch on Hot Spot? Nope, so on we go, worth a try, there was a very brief appeal primarily by the keeper

slugged straight up in the air and taken at square leg. It was a decent bumper, too quickly onto Bopara's hook, it went up and Williamson held the chance comfortably at square leg, really good bowling this from McClenaghan, banged it in and Bopara got it high on the bat to present another easy chance to the outfielders
full just outside off, driven hard past mid-off, reasonably timed and they get a couple, should have been three I reckon
paddled down to long leg, there's a fumble from Franklin so they come back for the second and Franklin then hits direct from long leg as Bresnan, diving back, is well short of his ground
around the wicket, back of a length, Broad gets inside it and tries to hook but misses

another high fly ball and who else, Nathan McCullum taking the catch! It was a short ball, Broad was late on the hook, tried to slap it down the ground but put it straight up and another simple chance falls into the ring and McNath is the man today, three drops but four catches so now into the positive

back of a length just outside off, guided down to third man and the fielder gets in quickly and takes a sliding catch a very smart grab that and England are all out. Tredwell just tried to use the pace and steer it down fine, made a good connection but these short boundaries mean third man is quite close and was able to rush in and take that catch

inn2.comm: good length in the channel outside off, seaming away a touch and left alone
flicks the ball to leg, slightly back of a length and takes the inside edge, picked up on the 45 and the throw is a direct hit but Ronchi was home
short and sliding down the leg side, misses with a flick
gets across his stumps and shows a length ball the full face of the bat
slightly back of a length and in the corridor, dabbed to point, playing away from the body
Ronchi opens the shoulders and throws the plumbing at a back-of-a-length delivery, completely misses and then gets a few comments on his technique from Broad
good pace and carry, in the channel outside off, another swing and a miss
pitched up, on middle stump and straightens just enough to take the edge as Guptill tries to whip to leg, the ball flies inches wide of the diving Tredwell at second slip!
full and straight and driven to mid-on, slightly closing the bat face
lovely delivery, tight line on off stump and nibbles just enough to beat the outside edge as Ronchi pushes forward
this is a HUGE leading edge as Ronchi scissors the bat down at an angle, trying to clip through midwicket and skewering the ball through the vacant gully region and down to third man
strays down the leg side and that's a wide
a touch too straight, steps across and works a couple through midwicket
drags his length back, defended on the back foot outside off
pitched up outside off, gets forward and drives off the outer half of the bat to backward point, good stop but they pick up one
full and slightly wide again, better timing from Guptill, who opens the face and caresses this low through backward point, beating the dive
angled in and turned through the leg side off a length
pacy bouncer from Broad, outside off and beating Ronchi's flail as he steps away to leg
makes room again and this time is beaten by a length ball over the top of off stump trying to hack it out of the ground
dug in short, rising fast in the channel outside off, must have been close to being a wide on height as Ronchi misses again
length ball, jags back in a touch and takes the inside edge, rolls to leg
good length and shaping in around off, again squeezed out into the on side
steps away and goes for the an old-fashioned yahoo down the ground, gets a thick inside edge to backward square leg

another mistimed slog from Ronchi and Trott takes the catch at third man to put him out of his misery! This was coming down the track all the way from San Antonio - a length ball, hacking across the line and a thick edge bagged on the rope
stays back and tapped to point

played on, Anderson has another! This maybe kept a touch low, pitched up in the channel outside off and Guptill defended away from his front pad with an angled bat, clipped the edge and cannoned back on to the stumps! Ronchi they may have been ambivalent about but England are ecstatic at this wicket
short and at the man, goes back and thinks about pulling before dropping the hands
gets forward and pushes into the covers
taken off the pads between mid-on and deep midwicket for a couple
good length, angling and and Williamson gets an inside-edge on to his front pad, the ball rolls short and they steal one
good line, in the channel and nipping back as Taylor thrusts out his front pad and leaves
wider on the crease, length delivery, Taylor attempts to cut as the ball leaves him and misses
venomous inswinger from Anderson, jagging back off the pitch and practically through Williamson's bread basket
good leave this time, though a length ball is perilously close to clipping the top of off
pitched up and angled in on off, blocked coming forward
gets across and opens the face to steer and length delivery to third man
maintaining a line of harassment outside off, Taylor pushes forward and gets an inside edge to square leg
slightly overpitched and that's a peachy on drive from Williamson, gorgeous timing, just beats the dive of mid-on and trundles merrily away
on the stumps, worked through square leg
hops back in the crease and punches on the up through the covers to the sweeper
sliding towards leg stump, jabs across the line to fine leg
good bumper from Bresnan, wide of the stumps and Williamson tries to fetch it through midwicket, picks out the fielder
length ball, wide of the stumps, steered through cover off the back foot

seaming in and rapped on the pad, Oxenford gives it after a few seconds' thought - but Taylor immediately reviews. He was struck on the back leg, on the thigh as he was coming forward - Hot Spot shows no inside edge ... and the decision stands, Taylor is out! It was in line with off, thudding into the off ball. New Zealand are three down and they've lost their review
on the stumps, nudged off the pads through backward square
pitched up outside off stump, McCullum leaves the crease and drives through the covers
slightly back of a length, waits and rolls the wrists through a clip to deep midwicket
bit of width, rocks back and thrashes a cut shot away to the man on the fence, just a single
beats the bat, he's a deceptive bowler Bopara and this doesn't seem to do much, line and length in the corridor, drifts past Williamson's prod
length delivery, steered away through backward point for one more
length ball, banged in outside off, Williamson turns through backward square leg
McCullum is busy the crease as ever, stands up to a length ball and tries to crash a cut shot away ... it thumps into Buttler's gloves
another flay and a miss from the batsman, trying to play the same cut shot
banged in very short, this climbs rapidly over the batsman's head and Buttler does well to grab it
stays in the crease and pushes a shortish ball to mid-on
bit of width, opens the arms and slices down to third man
punishing pull shot from Williamson, gets outside the line of off and is ready for the short ball, cracking it to the fence between mid-on and deep midwicket
fullish, tailing in around off and blocked into the covers
slightly short, this kicks up and surprises McCullum, who defends around off
another dot ball, McCullum tries to get forward but can only push into the covers
pitched up, on the walk McCullum punches through the covers to the sweeper
this seems to stop in the pitch as Williamson drops his bat on a length ball on off
waits on a length ball outside off, dabs it into the ground towards third man
tossed up outside off stump, played with the spin to midwicket
quicker delivery, drops a touch short, stands up and punches to long-on
skidding through on the stumps, bunted hard into the ground by McCullum and Tredwell fields on the bounce
pushed through on the off stump, worked to mid-on
flat and on the off stump, again McCullum can't work it past mid-on
tossed up, bit of zip on the off, manages to dig this one out to long-on
out the back of the hand, I think, this is floated up wide - and outside the tramlines
length ball on the stumps, McCullum tries to crash this over midwicket but pulls into the ground
advances and Bopara follows him, played through a gap in the covers with an angled bat
length ball wide of the stumps, cracked through point, they'll get back for two

on the stumps, hooked fiercely to deep square leg and Root takes a fabulous catch diving forward! Big wicket for England, thanks to a terrific bit of fielding - McCullum didn't quite get it out of the meat of the bat, maybe a slightly slower delivery, it was dying on Root as he lined it up and then plunged forward to complete the dismissal
on the stumps, stays in the crease and taps to deep square leg
gets forward and dabs one wide of mid-off
pushed through and squeezed down to third man off the toe of the bat
round the wicket, on a length outside off, steered through backward point for another single
tossed up on off, chipped back and Tredwell fields on the bounce
solid blow from Williamson, skips out on his toes and lofts to long-off, one-bounce four
pushed through and Williamson defends coming forward, nearly rolls back on to his stumps via inside edge and pad
whips a single through midwicket
slightly short, rocks back and pulls down the ground to long-on
length ball over the top of middle and leg, jabbed short and square and it's gobbled up
dug in, at the man and hooked from outside off, walking across, big top edge and it goes high towards fine leg, there's no one there and it bounces over the rope
angled across him, tries to play through mid-off, too straight and Bopara fields

sliced off the outside edge and taken at backward point! Another wicket falls - is this good or bad for England?! Bopara skidded one across Franklin, who swished loosely at it, flew quickly off the bat but straight into the safe mitts of Morgan, he throws the ball high into the air in celebration!
shuffles across his stumps, tries to leg glance and it clips the pad, beats Buttler's dive and heads to the boundary
presses forward and then back as a length ball skids on, punches to long-on
round the wicket, pushed into the covers and they get one on a misfield
spinning back in from outside off, cramps Williamson as he tries to cut
gets forward and drives one to long-on
tossed up wide of the stumps, knocked through cover point to the sweeper
bit of width and Williamson gives this some tap, sitting back in the crease and cracking a cut shot in front of square for four
angled across on a length, driven on the up through the covers
angled in, tries to pull across the line and a edge balloons via the pad to short third man
tight lien on middle stump, jams the ball down on to his pads and they scamper through as Bresnan tidies up
length ball, lofted out towards wide mid-on, in one of the corners of this odd-shaped ground, good clean hit but again slightly short of the rope
stays back and dabs into the leg side
bouncer, steepling over Anderson as he comes forward and pulls out of the shot
fired across, bit of width but Anderson thrashes a cut shot straight to backward point
round the wicket to the right-hander, floated up on leg stump and smashed down the ground, driven along the floor, Root pulls of a diving stop to prevent four
skips out and chips towards long-off, cries of "catch it!" from Tredwell but it lands safely
that's gone all the way, New Zealand's first six and it'll be exercising the fella in his coracle bobbing on the River Taff. In the slot and Anderson slogs it miles over long-on
pushed through a lot quicker, Anderson backs away and pushes back down the track
again speared in on leg stump and Anderson makes room, drills the ball back and Tredwell makes a brilliant stop
touch short and pulled flat down to long-on
keeper up to the stumps, slower ball, crunched down to long-on
ducking, over the top off, Williamson tries to dab at it and the ball deflects off Buttler's gloves, I think, to short third man - no run

has this bowled Williamson? Or did Buttler knock the bails off? Buttler appears to be claiming the dismissal and the umpires take it upstairs. Replays show that the ball flew over the top of the stumps, rebounding back into the bail off Buttler's gloves. Williamson was in his crease, so not a stumping ... on we go, then
pitched up and driven back past the bowler
makes a bit of room and shovels the ball flat down the ground, Broad should cut this off and mid-off but he makes a hash of it, leading to a cry of exasperation from Bopara
slightly shorter length, punched off the back foot and this time Broad stops it at mid-off
slightly short and on leg stump, nudged towards midwicket and Broad gives chase in his follow through
back away and gives himself plenty of room to cut a short straight ball over cover into an unguarded part of the ground for four
Williamson backs off again, Broad follows him and he dabs into the covers
on the stumps, tries to plays across the line and it deflects off the pad to third man
Broad goes short and down the leg side as Williamson tries to make room, swings and misses
good stuff again from Broad, another well-directed bouncer, throws the bat, gets nothing on it
angled across short of a length, cut off the back foot and Anderson wants one, it's well stopped by Trott and his throw isn't far from catching the batsman out of his ground as he scrambles back
full and on leg stump, clubbed out towards long-on and they get back for a second - isn't causing too much inconvenience, then
slower ball, on the stumps, shovelled through midwicket for a single
back of a length, seaming back and rearing at Williamson, who blocks back on to the track
fullish and tailing in, Williamson heaves across the line and squirts the ball out through deep backward square - that's four and a well-played fifty
angled in and worked through the leg side
full and on leg stump, Williamson anticipates it well and shuffles away, gets up the ball and launches it high over deep midwicket ... this is still on, you know
dug in straight, makes room and flat-bats a pull shot in front of deep midwicket, they get back for two
sprays this one down the leg side - wide
short again, at the man and pulled meatily round the corner, this flies away for four more to deep backward square!
full and slightly outside off, drives uppishly and just short off Cook on the edge of the ring at mid-off
low full toss, Anderson back away and slices the ball through the vacant slips to third man - four more
makes an early moves across his stumps, Bresnan fires it in full, Anderson heaves across the line and gets an edge on to his front pad, it roll into the covers
length ball on the stumps, steps away and jams the ball into the covers

full and fast, tries to go big but it spoons into the air and Anderson takes it at cover - but they check for the no-ball. It's so close, just a few atoms of rubber in it but Steve Davis in the third umpire's chair decides it's okay and Williamson trudges off to muted applause!
length ball, Anderson backs away and carts flat down the ground to long-on
length and in the channel, McCullum doesn't move his feet, drives and is beaten
hosp across and nudges one to leg
touch short and short-arm jabbed forcefully over midwicket, Bopara does well on the boundary to stop it bouncing over the rope
Bresnan bangs in it, McCullum works the ball through midwicket

full and straight, slogged down the ground and taken at long-on! Anderson catches his namesake and Bresnan claims the wicket, decent hit but straight at one of England's best fielders. The fat lady is taking a sip of water
bouncer, quick and straight and that's sconed him, deflects off the helmet as McCullum misses with his pull shot, leg bye to third man
short and sliding down the leg side, Mills helps the ball through backward square and it beats Bopara's despairing dive
full and straight, in the blockhole, Mills keeps his eye on it and digs it out into the covers
pitched up outside off, squeezes the ball out to backward point, they run anyway
slung down on a length, McCullum had moved across in advance and Anderson went wider
again McCullum shifts outside off, perfect wide yorker from Anderson and the batsman fails to get anything on it
full toss on leg stump, doesn't get the yorker right this time and McCullum bunts it for four to deep square leg
get this one right up to the stumps again, outside off and McCullum again misses the yorker
length ball, spots him moving outside off again and gets this right over the tramline as McCullum swings and misses
bouncer, over the batsman - called on height
full toss from Anderson, dipping just under waist height as McCullum crunches it way back straight back down the ground for six!
line and length, swings and nicks off, Anderson finishes with a wicket! Too good for McCullum and just too much to do for New Zealand - a 10-run win means England are through to the semi-finals
